docs.snippet: LONDON, July 23 Unbeaten Portugal rallied from a threegoal deficit today to beat North Korea, 5-3, and more into the semi-finals of the World Cup soccer tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 23 Unbeaten Portugal rallied from a threegoal deficit today to beat North Korea, 5-3, and more into the semi-finals of the World Cup soccer tournament.

headline.main: PORTUGAL GAINS IN WORLD SOCCER; Favorite Ousts North Korea  England, W. Germany, Russia Also Advance PORTUGAL GAINS IN WORLD SOCCER

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 25 (AP)-- The World Soccer Federation suspended three Uruguayan stars today and recommended disciplinary action against England's team manager, Alf Ramsey.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 25 (AP)-- The World Soccer Federation suspended three Uruguayan stars today and recommended disciplinary action against England's team manager, Alf Ramsey.

docs.snippet: The marriage of Mrs. Susan Dawson Cordes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Balloch Dawson of Washington and Brooklin, Me., to Weston Dugal Thomas, son of Mr. and Mrs. Weston Gage Thomas of Delray Beach, Fla., took place here at the Unitarian Church of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The marriage of Mrs. Susan Dawson Cordes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Balloch Dawson of Washington and Brooklin, Me., to Weston Dugal Thomas, son of Mr. and Mrs. Weston Gage Thomas of Delray Beach, Fla., took place here at the Unitarian Church of All Souls yesterday.

headline.main: Weston Thomas Weds Mrs. Susan D. Cordes

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 27 Copies of the Uruguayan weekly news magazine Marcha were confiscated by police agents last night as the new military regime moved to tighten control over the press. At many newsstands, the police also seized copies of Epoca, a...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 27 Copies of the Uruguayan weekly news magazine Marcha were confiscated by police agents last night as the new military regime moved to tighten control over the press. At many newsstands, the police also seized copies of Epoca, a leftist Montevideo newspaper.
docs.abstract: police seize Uruguayan pubs; BA La Prensa scores ban on Tia Vicenta; Ongania bans right-wing business pub which detailed business-mil struggle to control regime; reptdly irks business by seeking to conciliate Peronist labor leaders; Min Martinez refuses to answer queries on Tacuara links, Foreign Press Assn, BA

headline.main: ARGENTINE CURBS ON PRESS TIGHTEN; Uruguayan Magazine and Newspaper Are Seized

byline.original: By H.J. MAIDENBERG Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: President Zalman Shazar of Israel received warm tributes  and salutes here yesterday at the start of a seven-day visit to the United States.

docs.abstract: Pres Shazar in NYC on informal US visit; gets official reception; to be Pres Johnson's guest in Washington; Johnson inv seen underscoring friendly US-Israeli ties

headline.main: ISRAEL'S LEADER FLIES IN FROM RIO; City Gives a Warm Welcome to President Shazar
A Big Welcome For Israeli Leader

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 30 England, deprived of a victory by a German goal in the last 15 seconds of regular play, broke through in overtime today and won the World Cup, emblematic of international soccer supremacy, by beating West Germany, 4-2. England's first...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 30 England, deprived of a victory by a German goal in the last 15 seconds of regular play, broke through in overtime today and won the World Cup, emblematic of international soccer supremacy, by beating West Germany, 4-2. England's first World Cup victory was witnessed by a crowd of 100,000 in Wembley Stadium.

headline.main: 2 Goals in Overtime Give British First World Cup; ENGLAND WINS, 4-2, IN SOCCER FINAL

byline.original: By W. GRANGER BLAIR Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 30 (Reuters) England, which came to a virtual standstill for 2 hours this afternoon, erupted with spontaneous joy tonight after its soccer team won the World Cup for the first time.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 30 (Reuters) England, which came to a virtual standstill for 2 hours this afternoon, erupted with spontaneous joy tonight after its soccer team won the World Cup for the first time.

headline.main: Austerity Is Repealed for a Day As Britons Swarm to the Pubs
